page.title: 15Three Owls Bird Sanctuary
page.content: The Three Owls Bird Sanctuary in Norden was founded in 1963 by a lady called Mrs. Watkinson. She looked after injured birds and soon got a reputation around Norden and Rochdale. Since then it has grown and now there are more than 600 birds there. The aim is to return birds to the wild when they are well but many of them choose to stay. The sanctuary runs on donations and voluntary help. Young people have helped to build ponds for water birds. There are owls, kestrels, gulls, gannets and lots of other birds. Recently two of the herons nested. The female laid five eggs and two of them hatched out. The chicks were lovely and grew very quickly. It is very unusual for this to happen, so the birds must be very happy there.
